Text.content: Below is an example content shown that we will use throughout this chapter to learn the basics of writing a formatter. The example is a simple section content with three content fieldsâ€”Title, Text, and Image. Although we do not care about the internal content definition, we should know at this point, that the fields are typed: Title is a simple string value, Text contains HTML with inline markup, and Image is a complex type with child elements. The fields are contained in wrapper element with a language attribute making it possible to store section contents in different languages. There are additional rules regarding the structure: in the example we assume that Title and Text are required elements that always exist, whilst Image is an optional element that may be completely missing. We assume that Title in contrast to Text may not be empty.
